title: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel tells the story of racial injustice and the loss of innocence in the American South.
author: Harper Lee

description: George Orwell's dystopian masterpiece explores themes of surveillance, censorship, and totalitarianism.
author: George Orwell

title: The Great Gatsby
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's classic novel depicts the lavish lifestyle and moral decay of the wealthy during the Roaring Twenties.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

title: Moby-Dick
description: Herman Melville's epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the great white whale, Moby-Dick.
author: Herman Melville

title: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's romantic comedy follows the tumultuous relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy in 19th-century England.
author: Jane Austen

title: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's influential novel explores themes of alienation and teenage angst through the perspective of its protagonist, Holden Caulfield.
author: J.D. Salinger

title: Brave New World
description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian vision of a future society where genetic engineering, psychological conditioning, and social control are rampant.
author: Aldous Huxley

title: The Lord of the Rings
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic fantasy trilogy follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

title: Jane Eyre
description: Charlotte Brontë's classic novel follows the experiences of its eponymous heroine as she navigates love, independence, and societal expectations.
author: Charlotte Brontë

title: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's beloved adventure novel chronicles the journey of Bilbo Baggins as he embarks on a quest to reclaim the treasure guarded by the dragon Smaug.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
